Article.Abstract: ESAT-6 is an important T-cell antigen recognized by protective T cells in animal models of infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis. In an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) with overlapping peptides spanning the sequence of ESAT-6, monoclonal antibody HYB76-8 reacted with two peptides in the N-terminal region of the molecule. Assays with synthetic truncated peptides allowed a precise mapping of the epitope to the residues EQQWNFAGIEAAA at positions 3 to 15. Hydrophilicity plots revealed one hydrophilic area at the N terminus and two additional areas further along the polypeptide chain. Antipeptide antibodies were generated by immunization with synthetic 8-mer peptides corresponding to these two regions coupled to keyhole limpet hemocyanin. Prolonged immunization with a 23-mer peptide (positions 40 to 62) resulted in the formation of antibodies reacting with the peptide as well as native ESAT-6. A double-antibody ELISA was then developed with monoclonal antibody HYB76-8 as a capture antibody, antigen for testing in the second layer, and antipeptide antibody in the third layer. The assay was suitable for quantification of ESAT-6 in M. tuberculosis antigen preparations, showing no reactivity with M. bovis BCG Tokyo culture fluid, used as a negative control, or with MPT64 or antigen 85B, previously shown to cross-react with HYB76-8. This capture ELISA permitted the identification of ESAT-6 expression from vaccinia virus constructs containing the esat-6 gene; this expression could not be identified by standard immunoblotting.
Article.ArticleTitle: B-cell epitopes and quantification of the ESAT-6 protein of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Article.Affiliations: Institute of Immunology and Rheumatology, University of Oslo, Norway. morten.harboe@labmed.uio.no.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The monoclonal antibody was shown to recognize recombinant ESAT-6 and Mycobacterium tuberculosis culture filtrate. It did not bind to BCG Tokyo culture filtrate. The antibody was also successfully used in a double antibody ELISA in conjunction with a polyclonal antibody targeting a second ESAT epitope.
The minimal reactive epitope was mapped by truncation analysis with synthetic peptides.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A cysteine residue was added to the N-terminus of the peptide for coupling to KLH.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The assay antigens were overlapping peptides spanning the ESAT-6 sequence, and the strongest reaction was against the peptide spanning residues 22-45.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The anti-p40-62 antibodies reacted with ESAT-6 in Western blotting, and reacted with rESAT-6 in later bleedings. The antibody was also shown to recognize recombinant vaccinia virus-expressed ESAT-6 and Mycobacterium tuberculosis culture filtrate. The antibody was successfully used in a double antibody ELISA in conjunction with a monoclonal antibody targeting a second ESAT epitope.
